channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon said the U.S. economy is facing unprecedented risks that have him preparing for dramatic upheavals https://t.co/fETTolyvg1
A beloved mayor and her family helped townspeople resist Russian occupation. They paid for it with their lives. https://t.co/GKWrELCfzh

Watch: A WSJ analysis of videos, photos and satellite images from four weeks in March reveals how Russian forces destroyed civilian infrastructure through a series of shellings, with remnants of weapons indicating the use of cluster bombs https://t.co/Wy22J6up5E
The EU is planning to sanction two of Vladimir Putin's daughters, diplomats familiar with the proposal say https://t.co/I8a8sudW7f
The Czech Republic has been sending old Soviet-era tanks into Ukraine, marking the first time a foreign country has provided tanks to Ukraine since Russia’s invasion began https://t.co/UWOFjktE3V
Breaking: JetBlue made an offer to buy Spirit Airlines in an all-cash deal, setting off a potential bidding war with Frontier for the ultra low cost airline https://t.co/sIUmvQYo60

From @WSJopinion: The scenes of murder and mass graves from Bucha and other towns and cities in Ukraine are shocking the world, and we hope they linger in memory for longer than a TikTok video https://t.co/OY0VlpN0IY
A beloved mayor and her family helped townspeople resist Russian occupation. They paid for it with their lives. https://t.co/uITn2Oe36S

Shein, the China-based fast-fashion retailer, is now worth more than H&M and Zara combined, after a funding round valued the startup at $100 billion #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/9wGWAgplhG https://t.co/9Z2zvYGhaQ

The U.S. and the EU are set to unveil new sanctions on Russia this week, after allegations from Ukraine of potential war crimes against civilians by Russian forces galvanized a push for tougher measures against the Kremlin https://t.co/Q0Ix5qlp2L

A Shanghai resident didn’t test positive for Covid-19 or experience any symptoms, but she was ordered to board a bus for a mass quarantine center. Nearly 16 hours later, she hadn’t eaten a bite, sipped any water or gone to the bathroom. https://t.co/ChqvFUmkQl
A Senate panel deadlocked on Ketanji Brown Jackson's nomination to the Supreme Court, forcing a full Senate vote tonight that is expected to move it forward https://t.co/xxX86Sefq9
One of Boeing's new Air Force One planes was hit by a mishap at its factory, people familiar with the matter said. The incident risked damaging the presidential jet. https://t.co/1SQIatn6JC

Twitter said it plans to appoint Tesla CEO Elon Musk to its board of directors a day after he disclosed a 9.2% stake in the social-media company #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/JCv0KApfkX https://t.co/eUnXAocckh
The EU is planning to sanction two of Vladimir Putin's daughters, diplomats familiar with the proposal say https://t.co/xK1NqlQ7MO

GM and Honda say they will work together on underlying technology that would be used to produce several electric models, including compact sport-utility vehicles, for North and South America and China https://t.co/HCgd7k25X1
Biden administration officials are seeking ways to boost oil imports from Canada, but they don’t want to resurrect the Keystone XL pipeline https://t.co/r45hhgFWLq

Watch: A WSJ analysis of videos, photos and satellite images from four weeks in March reveals how Russian forces destroyed civilian infrastructure through a series of shellings, with remnants of weapons indicating the use of cluster bombs https://t.co/8o9UhLRdnH

French prosecutors have opened an investigation into whether war crimes have been committed in Ukraine following accounts of rape and killings of hundreds of civilians in Bucha and other formerly Russian-occupied towns https://t.co/UVStX1BbIz
Shoppers are cutting back on household staples, which have been reliably resistant to inflation, and switching to store brands: “It doesn’t smell as nice” https://t.co/2QxOkrVuY2
Twitter said it will appoint Elon Musk to its board of directors, a day after he disclosed a 9.2% stake in the company https://t.co/YpnUF187M1
The Czech Republic has been sending old Soviet-era tanks into Ukraine, marking the first time a foreign country has provided tanks to Ukraine since Russia’s invasion began https://t.co/Ep02gM3SYO
The EU is set to propose broad new sanctions on Russia, including a ban on coal imports and further action against oligarchs https://t.co/Y7CbONgnbg

Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky is preparing to address the U.N. Security Council after warning that newly uncovered atrocities could be worse than those in the city of Bucha https://t.co/1LaTzrzNup
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcm8q https://t.co/RqyL5Y99EZ

From @WSJopinion: Trust in public health is at an all-time low. When agencies bypass their own experts, it only reinforces the perception that health policy is driven by groupthink and politics, writes Marty Makary. https://t.co/TdRPPo9e35
The Kansas Jayhawks pulled off the biggest comeback ever for an NCAA title game, trailing North Carolina by as much as 16 points during the game https://t.co/Jq74t60KKx

Elon Musk’s newly disclosed 9.2% stake in Twitter makes him the largest shareholder of the social media-company, topping co-founder and former CEO Jack Dorsey and elbowing out numerous financial institutions. Here's a list of the top 10 holders. https://t.co/svOeIXael7
Kansas staged a stunning comeback from a huge halftime deficit to win the NCAA men’s basketball championship https://t.co/ydYcCngdvL
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky visited Bucha on Monday, and described Russian forces as “murderers” and “rapists,” and vowed to hold the perpetrators accountable https://t.co/37hjOhGFC1
Elon Musk has set the stage for a new fight with the SEC, this time over how he disclosed his investment in Twitter https://t.co/LxsiYmeiOc
Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson has cleared an early hurdle on her way to all but certain confirmation, as three Republicans joined all Democrats in moving her nomination forward https://t.co/vI6k3ZtX6o

From @WSJopinion: The outcome in Ukraine will define a new world order, for good or ill. The U.S. can restore its leadership of the free world, or it can lead from behind while democracy continues to lose ground, writes Garry Kasparov. https://t.co/5EsePmOyzD
Cancún and the Riviera Maya, Mexico’s top tourism spots, are fighting a wave of violent crime. The problem is demand for drugs by tourists. https://t.co/Ag2wuGcOrC

Elon Musk’s newly disclosed 9.2% stake in Twitter makes him the largest shareholder of the social media-company, topping co-founder and former CEO Jack Dorsey and elbowing out numerous financial institutions. Here's a list of the top 10 holders. https://t.co/lGg9E4pX2Q

The U.S. plans to unveil additional sanctions on Russia this week, President Biden’s national security adviser said, condemning reports of atrocities in parts of Ukraine while declining to label Russian forces’ alleged actions as genocide https://t.co/57qwclOrja
From @WSJopinion: In 1961, a "stop the steal" movement might well have been justified. Nixon did the right thing and conceded, writes @Peggynoonannyc https://t.co/CzTfcPqYjL
U.S. and Spanish authorities seized a $90 million super yacht in Spain that they said is owned by a sanctioned oligarch with close ties to Russian President Vladimir Putin https://t.co/RNjJOgAiKP
From @WSJopinion: If Putin gains from this war, there will be more invasions, more war crimes, and more horrific scenes like those in Bucha in the future https://t.co/51qj13wne6
Germany expelled 40 Russian diplomats on Monday in response to Moscow’s alleged war crimes against civilians in Ukraine https://t.co/fQLjc3zymg
Russia’s war against Ukraine is raising questions over whether President Vladimir Putin or his commanders will be charged with war crimes. Here’s what you need to know. https://t.co/Hwz1R83Ck4
Sanctions imposed on Russia are disrupting China’s ambitions to move more exports by rail to Europe. “It’s a painful setback,” one consultant says https://t.co/yxZj5uZzcS

The Senate Judiciary Committee is set to deadlock on Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson’s Supreme Court nomination. That will set up another vote on the Senate floor, where a simple majority is needed to overcome the tie and move her nomination forward. https://t.co/qNtOzoI4eS
Carrie Lam, who led Hong Kong through antigovernment protests and the Covid-19 pandemic, says she won't see another term as chief executive. https://t.co/ghPTfTn4Fl

President Biden called for a war-crimes trial over allegations of atrocities committed by Russian forces in Bucha. “This guy is brutal,” he said of Russian President Vladimir Putin, “and what’s happening in Bucha is outrageous and everyone has seen it.” https://t.co/X32coJJcma

French President Macron’s call for sanctions banning imports of Russian oil and coal into the European Union following allegations of atrocities in Ukraine is set to trigger the most divisive intra-EU clash yet over response to President Putin’s invasion https://t.co/H1uDrY7zvb
JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon said the U.S. economy is facing unprecedented risks that have him preparing for dramatic upheavals https://t.co/8qL5V7Iv3L

Jamie Dimon, JPMorgan’s CEO, said in his annual letter to shareholders the U.S. should send Ukraine billions of dollars in aid, expand sanctions and help European allies with the refugee crisis as part of a strong response to Russia’s aggression https://t.co/4ghGDJ3PQQ

Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky addressed the Grammy Awards, asking the music industry to support his country’s war effort. Winners at the ceremony included Olivia Rodrigo and Jon Batiste. #GRAMMYs #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/86Sli2ffy0 https://t.co/zstAIYvpKs
South Carolina won its second NCAA women’s basketball championship, dealing UConn its first loss in a national title game, 64-49 https://t.co/pwyHgDfPg2
